title: Watch_Dogs
review: The closest thing to a modern-day Assassin's Creed we're probably gonna get for awhile. Absolutely wonderful game. Aiden Pearce is an awesome character, the plot twist is pretty surprising and intriguing, the gameplay's very fun and just challenging enough. 100% worth the dough, imo.

title: Watch_Dogs
review: i have already played watch dogs 1 on my console but missed out on bad blood dlc and finally played it on steam. The main story of aiden and dlc both are amazing. When we compare it to other watch dogs, watch dogs 1 and bad blood hold the best story writing. The game does show its age with time but still enjoyable even in 2024. gameplay is really nice but shooting and driving are not the best. After an hour or so u will get used to it though. Best playable on 60 fps, if u play on 120 fps u will run into some issues during elevator animation and few places here and there. But still my favourite watch dogs in the series.

title: Watch_Dogs
review: So much fun and so many options for play.  Excellent

title: Watch_Dogs
review: The only way to enjoy a ubislop game nowadays is to throw on one nearly a decade or more old. Would recommend with mods.

title: Watch_Dogs
review: very good game, but it has a gamebreaking glitch thats unavoidable. about halfway through the campaign, you get to a mission called "not a job for tyrone" and in this mission, you have to hack into his house via a power box, but while hacking into his house, tyrone just randomly falls through the floor of his house. ive tried everything i could have to make him not fall to his inevitable doom, but it just seems unavoidable.

title: Watch_Dogs
review:
Love the hacking systems, ability to manipulate the environment, and the game mechanics. 

Game suffers from horrible sound. It's one of the few games where I put on subtitles because I genuinely couldn't hear the main character. Movement controls are also outdated and it's nearly impossible to remember how to break from cover, so I do hold the run button and try to wrestle the game until I get where I want.

title: Watch_Dogs
review:
Watch_Dogs™ is like Clone of GTA series placed at Chicago but with some additional you can hack some system with Smartphone. Story/Mission is good and enjoyable, combat also good many tactic you can use. 

I dont like the UI because is quite simple and for driving I don't like it but still can enjoy it. Also when receive call for mission, when Aiden (MC) running no animation calling. 

It's worth it at Sale but if you already have it free at Uplay I'm not recommend for buy it.

title: Watch_Dogs
review: Good game. Even though it is first game of watch dogs series this is good to play.

title: Watch_Dogs
review: I have a picky taste for games and usually most rarely exceed my expectations, this one exceeded my expectations in every way especially since this is a 2014 Ubisoft game. Just finished the main story and I would honestly say this is one of the best games I've played in a while.

title: Watch_Dogs
review:
Watch dogs is definitely in my top 5 best games I have ever played, I really liked the overall story, I also liked the many "side quests" you can do in the game (my favourites are the fixer contracts and the one where you intercept criminals), the gameplay is pretty solid, the movement is smooth and the graphics are stunning even for today's standards, though I have to say the lack of modding capability brings the game down a bit.

I recommend waiting for a promotion when the full game including DLC's are around £5, and for some reason multiplayer doesn't work when you buy the game through steam

title: Watch_Dogs
review:
Initially, i was really skeptical about the unresponsiveness of the open world. After 100%-ing the game after a few solid 30 hours, this was a solid experience thanks to the decent gameplay, great story/plot with interesting characters and amazing presentation with a neo-noir theme and a perfect original composed soundtrack. The only thing i would complain about, is the lack of attention to the driving physics - i would compare it to driving a car in a ice rink and their response to collisions, well they're dog shit - crowbcat did an excellent job to show how terrible the collisions in this game in general. <you can check out his video out in yt ;)>

8.9/10

review: the game is how i remembered when i was younger trying it out though i was wondering:how do i fix a specific bug where i can't even play online mode anymore? other than that,its litterally how i loved this masterpiece

title: Watch_Dogs
review: Still a very fun game, but god it is so buggy on my hardware. It is still a good enough game to where I played through it like 3 or 4 times on my xbox 360 and I have now beaten it on PC 100%

title: Watch_Dogs
review: This game is in my opinion the best out of the 2 (legion is NOT a game, it is a torture method), this game's story is 100 times better than Watch_Dogs 2, the only real problem with this game is that you have little to no replay value. I still HIGHLY recommend playing this game, since the story is amazing, the gameplay is a unique stealth, where you don't have to go for stealth, but it is way cooler if you do, and the graphics are also good

title: Watch_Dogs
review: The game is good , Graphics are also amazing considering its a 2014 game . Shooting mechanics are shit avoid shooting as much as possible , Driving vehicle feels a little bit awkward because somehow every car starts like a race car , Stealth is good to go . And my god the story and missions are amazing

title: Watch_Dogs
review:
Watch_Dogs, developed by Ubisoft, is an open-world action-adventure game that introduces players to the world of cyber warfare and surveillance. Set in a near-future version of Chicago, players control Aiden Pearce, a skilled hacker who uses his abilities to manipulate the city’s infrastructure via a central operating system (ctOS) while seeking revenge for a personal tragedy. The game is a unique blend of hacking, stealth, and traditional open-world combat, providing a fresh twist on the genre.

The standout feature of Watch_Dogs is its hacking mechanics, which allow players to control traffic lights, cameras, and even power grids to outsmart enemies and solve missions. The game also offers fluid driving mechanics, dynamic combat, and a diverse array of side activities, from criminal investigations to mini-games like poker. However, despite its innovative ideas, the game sometimes feels weighed down by its somewhat generic protagonist and a narrative that lacks the emotional depth it aims for. In addition, the world can feel underutilized, as many of the side missions fall into repetitive patterns.

Pros:

-Innovative hacking mechanics that add depth to gameplay.
-Expansive and detailed open-world Chicago.
-Diverse set of side activities and mini-games.

Cons:

-Main story and protagonist feel underdeveloped.
-Repetitive side missions and objectives.
-Hacking mechanics can become overly simplified over time.

Overall, Watch_Dogs presents a fresh and creative take on the open-world genre, especially for players who enjoy technological themes and hacking. While it doesn’t fully capitalize on its potential, it remains an enjoyable experience with its innovative gameplay mechanics. 7.5/10

title: Watch_Dogs
review:
Great game, I can't believe I shoved it off for 10 years because I didn't try to understand why the people around me loved playing it. Ironic how a game I didn't like for so long was actually something I enjoyed playing so much of, with a protagonist I had ZERO issue with playing as, I don't have many games like that where I can say I loved the protagonist and usually I spend hours trying to make my own protagonists only to then realize that it isn't my characters story to tell as it was predefined. 

Silver fox? Gladly, and there's room for me to even critique him after all the gameplay I've done.

title: Watch_Dogs
review:
Game completed
One of the most aggressively average games I have played.
Hacking gimmick and likable MC are the only parts of the game that can be said to be good, but other than that it's just a generic mass of nothing memorable. 
The first 10 hours are fine enough if hard to really remember either, but the time after that is simply a slog.
The main storyline is again nothing new, but like mentioned before MC makes it decent, sidequest are just busywork, worse it's boring repeatable busywork.
DLC Bad Blood is just MC with different skin doing exactly the same thing as before but with speedrun leveling.
While it is a decent timewaster, there is simply no reason not to play something else.

Once you get past ubisucks nonsense this is actually a good game. Reminder of when they just overhyped games instead of actively try to make them terrible

title: Watch_Dogs
review:
Watch Dogs Review
Rating: ★★★☆☆ (3/5)

Overview: Watch Dogs launched in 2014 as a highly anticipated title from Ubisoft, set in a near-future version of Chicago. Players step into the shoes of Aiden Pearce, a skilled hacker seeking vengeance after a family tragedy. While the game introduced an intriguing premise with its focus on hacking and surveillance, it garnered mixed reviews due to various gameplay and narrative elements.

Gameplay
Hacking Mechanics: The core feature of Watch Dogs is its hacking system, allowing players to manipulate various aspects of the environment, including traffic lights, cameras, and electronic devices. While the concept is innovative, the execution can feel limited. Hacking is often reduced to simple button prompts, which can detract from the sense of immersion.

Combat and Stealth: Combat in Watch Dogs is serviceable but lacks depth. Players can engage in direct confrontations, utilize a range of weapons, or take a stealthy approach. The stealth mechanics are not as refined as in other titles, leading to some frustrating moments when trying to evade detection.

Open World Exploration: The open-world environment of Chicago is richly detailed and filled with activities, from side missions to collectibles. However, while the world is visually impressive, it can feel empty and repetitive over time. The driving mechanics are decent, though vehicles can sometimes feel unwieldy.

Story and Characters
Narrative: The story centers around themes of revenge, privacy, and the consequences of a digitally connected world. While the premise is compelling, the execution often falls flat. Aiden Pearce can come off as a one-dimensional character, and the supporting cast lacks depth, making it hard to fully invest in their journeys.

Character Development: While Aiden's motivations are clear, his character development is limited. Supporting characters often feel like tropes rather than fully fleshed-out individuals, which weakens the overall narrative impact.

Graphics and Performance
Visuals: Watch Dogs showcases impressive graphics, particularly in its depiction of Chicago. The city is beautifully rendered, with detailed environments and realistic weather effects. However, some textures and animations can feel dated, particularly in comparison to more recent titles.

Performance: While the game runs reasonably well on most systems, players have reported occasional bugs and glitches that can disrupt the experience. Load times are generally acceptable, but some players may experience performance drops during intense action sequences.

Soundtrack and Audio
The soundtrack features a mix of ambient music and radio stations that fit the game's urban setting. Voice acting is decent, but the dialogue can sometimes feel wooden or clichéd, detracting from the overall immersion.

Conclusion
Watch Dogs is a game with a fascinating concept and an engaging world, but it ultimately struggles with execution. While the hacking mechanics and open-world exploration provide moments of enjoyment, the narrative and character development leave much to be desired.

Final Thoughts: If you're a fan of open-world games and enjoy themes of hacking and surveillance, Watch Dogs is worth a try. However, be prepared for some shortcomings in gameplay and storytelling. The game laid the groundwork for its sequels, which improved upon many of its flaws, making it an interesting entry point for the franchise but not without its faults.

title: Watch_Dogs
review: story rich, great visuals and a game wayyyy ahead of its time... Dont miss out on the Bad Blood DLC its even better than the main campaign.

title: Watch_Dogs
review:
despite the massive amounts of backlash it received in the past, the game really aged well and its a shame ubisoft dont produce this type of games anymore. it really is one of a kind. 
The gameplay is amazing, the storyline is intriguing, the characters, specifically Aiden, is very well written. Maybe thats because i've looked into things about his character that might not even be intentional, so he might not be as likeable as i make him be. But maybe thats a sign for others to look at things beyond the surface and do some deep dive, because he really is amazing. 

But the game is really good. The graphics are great but not extraordinary for the time it came out. I honestly dont know how to properly express the words in my brain. I've got over 100+ hours and i've played this game so much it messed with my brain for awhile. So draw your own conclusion from that i guess. Oh and buy bad blood too.

More: The multiplayer has been disabled, but it pretty much doesn't take anything away from the main game, its still enjoyable. The sidequests are repetitive but the ones where you have to search for audio logs really adds to the story. Plus, they're sidequests. You dont gotta do them if you find them boring.

title: Watch_Dogs
review:
Amazing game. 9/10, enjoyed it way more than i thought i would. The gameplay was good, gunplay was surprisingly good, the driving was good as well and graphically the game looks nice and polished as well for the age of the game. The story was amazing and the characters and there development were great. The story felt heavy and the sidemissions felt like you were actually being a vigilante (even though some of them felt a little dry and repetitive). 

Overall great game. I definitely recommend this.

title: Watch_Dogs
review:
I'm just about half-way through the game (in number of missions), and I'm not sure I'll bother completing the story at all - maybe just to place a checkmark on my backlog for a game that is somewhat notable and that to me is now representative of Ubisoft mediocrity. I'm pretty sure I bought this as part of some package and I wouldn't recommend paying more than $10 even if you're really curious about the game.

The game looks dated because the environmental art direction is lacking. It was trying to be realistic (for the time) and now the attempt just looks bland. It still manages to feel horribly optimized even with a decent PC from around 10 years after launch.

The story is so uninteresting and the characters so unlikeable that even the story missions feel almost as worthless of your time as all the crap "activities" that litter the map.

The gameplay is atrocious - the gunplay has no impact to it at all even with the heavy weapons, driving feels stiff and the camera works against you, the puzzles are braindead. This is a game where the gameplay was just barely tweaked to make a deceptive trailer, but the actual experience has very little to offer that'll impress.

Edit, after finishing main story and DLC: the Bad Blood DLC is worth the $10 bucks I mentioned as an acceptable price for the game if you can make it through the slog that is the main campaign, so consider getting it if you see the price with it fall that low. The main characters of the DLC actually have personality that can carry the short story for the few hours that it lasts, and the missions have enough variety to keep you interested throughout.

title: Watch_Dogs
review:
Bought it on sale as the trilogy bundle. Figured out - why the heck not, lets try it out. Game mechanics - basically almost like any other open world modern world exploration type game (GTA, Saints Row), except with a few more interactable objects throughout the game. New twist on side missions which unfortunately get tedious if you want to unlock items or achievements (IN-GAME, NOT STEAM). It can be fascinating to watch npcs, especially the privacy intrusions. The story is interesting, gameplay overall relatively fun.
MOUSE ACCELERATION - YOU CAN TURN IT OFF!!! Messed the game up for me for the first few hours, after that - smooth sailing.
The game is fun, if you can get in on a sale and like third person open world games - it's worth checking out.

title: Watch_Dogs
review: Honestly a good game there aren't many cars and there isn't any customizability to the cars.The graphics are fine by themselves but with mods it comes close to what i perceive as perfection.The driving isn't bad but i wouldn't consider it good.The game is fun to run around stop criminals do fixer contracts and with "The Living City" mod,the game becomes more alive and there are more things to do,there are more random events.The hacking in the game gets a bit boring after a while but for ubisofts first watch dogs it ain't bad.I wouldn't consider it an online game as my online ins't working.The cop chases are a bit too easy to stop and escape from and overall the difficulty is a bit too easy for my liking and the difficulty changer is only available after completing a certain mission.Which i haven't yet.The story is good enough for me and the character is pretty fun to play as although he is a bit to serious for my liking.
